TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit CharsetDecoder extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A converter that can convert a byte sequence from a charset into a 16-bit Unicode character sequence.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Java.Nio.CharBuffer Decode(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer in) cil managed

Docs.summary: This is a facade method for the decoding operation.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if another decoding operation is ongoing.
if an illegal input byte sequence for this charset was encountered, and the action for malformed error is

if a legal but unmappable input byte sequence for this charset was encountered, and the action for unmappable character error is . Unmappable means the byte sequence at the input buffer's current position cannot be mapped to a Unicode character sequence.
if another exception happened during the decode operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public Java.Nio.Charset.CoderResult Decode (Java.Nio.ByteBuffer in, Java.Nio.CharBuffer out, bool endOfInput);
.method public hidebysig instance class Java.Nio.Charset.CoderResult Decode(class Java.Nio.ByteBuffer in, class Java.Nio.CharBuffer out, bool endOfInput) cil managed
member this.Decode : Java.Nio.ByteBuffer * Java.Nio.CharBuffer * bool -> Java.Nio.Charset.CoderResult

Docs.param: true if all the input characters have been provided.
Docs.summary: Decodes bytes starting at the current position of the given input buffer, and writes the equivalent character sequence into the given output buffer from its current position.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.exception: if decoding has started or no more input is needed in this decoding progress.
if the method threw an BufferUnderflowException or BufferOverflowException.

Docs.exception: if this decoder does not implement an auto-detecting charset.
if insufficient bytes have been read to determine the charset.
